abstract: Samsung announces halt to production of Galaxy Note 7 smartphone and asks retailers and telecom carriers to stop selling them until defect that caused several fires is fixed; also requests consumers with any Galaxy Note 7 device to power it off and not use it.

byline.original: By DAISUKE WAKABAYASHI, CHOE SANG-HUN and VINDU GOEL
byline.contributor: Daisuke Wakabayashi and Vindu Goel reported from San Francisco. Choe Sang-Hun reported from Seoul, South Korea. Michelle Innis contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The move is a major setback for the world’s largest producer of smartphones, which had been gaining ground against Apple in the high-end market.

headline.main: Samsung Halts Galaxy Note 7 Production as Battery Problems Linger
headline.print_headline: Samsung Halts Galaxy Note 7 Production as Battery Issues Linger
